shortdesc.ph: Starts the last-mile network probe test.

section.p: This method starts the last-mile network probe test before joining a channel to get the uplink and downlink last mile network statistics, including the bandwidth, packet loss, jitter, and round-trip time (RTT).

Once this method is enabled, the SDK returns the following callbacks:
, It will return within 2 seconds depending on the network situation. This callback rates the network conditions and is more closely linked to the user experience.
, It will return within 30 seconds depending on the network situation. This callback returns the real-time statistics of the network conditions and is more objective.

This method applies to the `LIVE_BROADCASTING` channel profile.
Before a user joins a channel or before an audience switches to a host, call this method to check the uplink network quality.
This method consumes additional network traffic, and hence may affect communication quality.

ul.li: This method will consume a certain amount of network traffic and affect the quality of the call, so we recommend not to use it at the same time.
Otherwise, the callback may be interrupted by other methods, and hence may not be triggered.
A host should not call this method after joining a channel (when in a call).
